Judul: DESIGNING OPTIMUM PRODUCTION STRATEGY OF CO2-ACETONE MIXTURE INJECTION IN ���B��� STRUCTURE AT ���S��� FIELD
Abstrak:
Oil production in Indonesia shows a decreasing trend, while the oil demand is facing an accelerating growth.
CO2 Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) is one of the most popular EOR methods that has been proven to work on
improving oil recovery through miscibility mechanism. However, the high temperature of the reservoir in
Indonesia causes high MMP which makes it more difficult to achieve miscible injection. One way to reduce
MMP is by adding co-solvent to the injected CO2 with controlled composition. This study will focus on CO2
injection having Acetone as the co-solvent which implemented in “B” Structure at “S” Field.
In this study, there are two objectives. They are identifying the optimum composition of CO2-Acetone in
reducing MMP and designing the production strategy of CO2-Acetone mixture injection in "B" Structure at "S"
Field to obtain the highest recovery faktor. A sensitivity study of the optimum composition of CO2-Acetone is
done to observe the effect of Acetone in reducing MMP. The sensitivity study is simulated using CMG
WinpropTM. Various development scenarios are generated with the optimum composition as the composition of
gas injected. The development scenarios are simulated using CMG GEMTM. From the simulation results, the
performance of the reservoir which generates the highest recovery could be identified.
From the simulation result, Acetone is proven to reduce MMP in CO2-Acetone mixture injection. The optimum
composition of CO2-Acetone in reducing MMP is 89% CO2 + 11% Acetone. The optimum composition could
reduce MMP from 3859.56 psi to 2280.39 psi. By lowering MMP, miscible injection is possible to be done
without exceeding fracture pressure. The fracture pressure is estimated to be 2800 psi. The simulation result
shows that CO2-Acetone mixture injection could improve recovery factor up to 9% without infill well and 14%
with infill well.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Prof. Ir. Asep Kurnia Permadi, M.Sc., Ph.D.
Kata Kunci: CO2 injection, Minimum Miscibility Pressure (MMP), recovery factor, acetone, reservoir simulation
